entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. The type of ammunition is listed with this property. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition or 'shot'. For bows, drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended arrows or crossbow bolts by taking a minute to search the battlefield. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use and cannot be recovered.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon.

entries.name: Auto
entries: Automatic weapons have the capability of firing several shots with each attack. Before making an attack with a firearm with this property, you can choose to set the weapon to single-fire or auto-fire mode. When in auto-fire mode, you have a -2 penalty to your attack rolls due to weapon recoil and each attack consumes five shots. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is set to auto-fire.

entries.name: Chain
entries: You have access to a special attack option. Immediately after hitting a creature with this weapon as part of the Attack action, you can choose to sustain the initial hit and "chain" any remaining attacks that you would normally have access to through the Extra Attack feature. When you do so, you forfeit all remaining attacks and deal additional damage of the weapon's primary damage type equal to the number listed in parentheses for each forfeited attack.

entries.name: Feed
entries: A firearm with the feed property can only hold a limited number of ammunition rounds at a time, and it can only be loaded one round at a time. You can use a bonus action or substitute one of your attacks as part of the Attack action to load one round into the weapon. Alternatively, you can use an action to fully reload the weapon to its capacity, which is listed with this property in parentheses.

entries.name: Light
entries: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons. Additionally, when making a ranged attack with a weapon that has both the light and thrown properties, you can draw the weapon as part of the attack as long as you have a free hand and the weapon is kept in an accessible location, such as a bandolier or belt.

entries.name: Loading
entries: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries.name: Loading
entries: Weapons with the reload property can connect to a container of ammunition, such as a magazine, energy cell, or fuel tank. A limited number of shots can be consumed—indicated by the number in parentheses—before the container must be replaced using your choice of an action or a bonus action. You must have a replacement container of the appropriate size and type to reload the weapon.

entries.name: Strength
entries: Some weapons, like shotguns, fire a number of small projectiles in a random ‘spread’ pattern. These weapons are very powerful in close quarters, but their effectiveness decreases with distance from the target. There are two values included with this property in parentheses. The first value is the weapon’s “close range” in feet, and the second is the weapon's damage die when attacking a target in close range.

Additionally, when attacking a target beyond normal range, you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll, but the damage dealt on a hit is halved. If an attack beyond normal range is a hit, you can apply the attack’s damage to one additional creature that you can see within 5 feet of the target. You can’t attack a target beyond the weapon’s long range as normal.

entries.name: Strength
entries: This property is accompanied by a number, which is the minimum Strength score required to wield the weapon effectively. If you do not meet this requirement, you have disadvantage on all attack rolls made with the weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: Due to the weight of its fuel canisters, this weapon requires an action to reload. Additionally, you have access to a special attack option. As an action, you can spray fire in a 15-foot cone or a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 fire damage. This action consumes 5 shots.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon features a hydraulic piston that can be used to add force to your punches. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can activate the piston. When you do so, the weapon's damage dice becomes 1d10, and you add your proficiency bonus instead of your Strength modifier to the attack's damage. Once the piston has been activated, the system must recharge and it cannot be used again until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Advanced Treatment
entries: Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range each regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d8} + your powercasting ability modifier. This power has no effect on undead or constructs.
Hyperlanes (p. 110)
PHB (p. 267)

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a power slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Alert
entries: You create a program to alert you when certain conditions arise. This alarm must be used on a video camera network or some other type of sensor that can detect the trigger you set. Until the hack ends, you are alerted whenever your triggering condition is detected.

The alarm itself is only audible to you and people you invite to this hack trigger. The hack alerts you with a ping on your device when the triggering condition is sensed. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping.

Triggers are typically linked to video feeds, often using facial recognition, or a general “no one is allowed inside X” type command. This hack only affects one sensor (such as a camera or door). Attempts to evade trigger recognition require a Charisma (Deception) or Dexterity (Stealth) ability check against your hack DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a 2nd level spell slot, the duration increases to 8 hours. Using a 3rd level spell slot, the duration is 24 hours.
GeneFunk 2090

spell.name: Counterattack
entries: You direct your allies to openings in enemy defenses and bolster their confidence. When you cast this power, choose a number of creatures you can see within range equal to your proficiency bonus. For the duration, each of these creatures may use its reaction to make one weapon attack when it is hit by an attack.
Hyperlanes (p. 119)

spell.name: Intercept Communications
entries: You monitor all communications transmitted or received within range for the duration.
Hyperlanes (p. 110)

spell.name: Gravity Field
entries: You deploy a device at a point you can see within range that creates a 30-foot-radius sphere of altered gravity centered on that point. When you cast this power, you choose the effect: high gravity, low gravity, or zero gravity.
Based on: Alter Gravity from Hyperlanes (p.110)

spell.name: Analysis
entries: Choose one creature, object, or vehicle you can see within range. If the target is an object or vehicle, you learn all of its major functions and its current and maximum hit points. If the target is a creature, you learn its current and maximum hit points along with any damage immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities it possesses.
Hyperlanes (p.110)

spell.name: Electromagnetic Field
entries: You deploy a device at a point that you can see within range that creates an electromagnetic field in a 15-foot-radius sphere around it. Within this sphere, creatures must roll a {@dice d10} each time they attempt to use a different device that relies on electronics to function. The roll is made before the device is used or attack is made. On a roll of 6 or higher, the device functions normally; otherwise, it ceases to function until the start of their next turn or until they leave the field.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this power using a power slot of 4th level or higher, all electronic devices cease to function while within the field.
Based on Hyperlanes Antiscience Field (p. 110)

spell.name: Precision Fire
entries: For the duration, your ranged weapon attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this power using a power slot of 4th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the power for up to 1 hour. When you use a power slot of 5th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours.
Based on Arcing Fire from Hyperlanes (p. 111)

spell.name: Elemental Ammo
entries: You reload your weapon with a canister containing special ammunition. Choose a damage type: cold, fire, or lightning. Your attacks with the weapon deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the selected type. This effect lasts until six pieces of ammunition have been expended.

components.m: Ranged weapon with the reload property

spell.name: Dead Aim
entries: You have advantage on ranged attacks while you maintain {@status concentration} on this power.
Hyperlanes (p. 121)

spell.name: Bash
entries: Make a melee power attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage. If the target is a construct, the damage is instead {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage.
The power's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} or {@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} or {@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} or {@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Maneuver
entries: One creature you choose within range can immediately move up to its speed.

spell.name: Taunt
entries: You attempt to goad a target into attacking you. Choose one creature you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn.
Hyperlanes (Enemies, p. 124)

spell.name: Happy Gas
entries: You deploy an imperceptible mood-altering gas at a creature within range that isn't hostile toward you. For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at that creature. The effect ends early if you are more than 10 feet from the target for longer than 10 seconds.

When the spell ends, the creature realizes that you used a substance to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A creature {@condition prone} to violence might attack you. Another creature might seek retribution in other ways (at the DM’s discretion), depending on the nature of your interaction with it.

items: An exposed creature can't benefit from half or three-quarters cover.
A prone creature’s only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls using melee or two-handed ranged weapons.
An attack roll against the creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. An attack roll has disadvantage if the attacker is beyond 15 feet of the creature.
A suppressed creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
